byline.original: By SAM BORDEN and ANDREW DAS

abstract: United States may withdraw as host of 2016 Copa America, world's oldest international soccer tournament, over unresolved concerns about legal liability that emerged after several officials connected to tournament were arrested for corruption in May; national team is unlikely to play in tournament if US does not host.
lead_paragraph: After four months of doubt and speculation, the United States may withdraw as the host of the event in 2016 — and may not participate at all.

headline.main: Copa América’s Fate Uncertain as U.S. Soccer Skips Meeting
headline.print_headline: United States May Quit as Host of Copa América

snippet: After four months of doubt and speculation, the United States may withdraw as the host of the event in 2016 — and may not participate at all.

keywords.value: Confederation of North, Central American and Caribbean Association Football (CONCACAF)
keywords.name: organizations
